projectPurpose: To provide a fast and intuitive terminal-based user interface (TUI) for Git, inspired by Magit, for users who prefer working in the terminal but are not Emacs users.
mainFeatures: Viewing commits and opening files in editor

alternatives.name: tig
mainFeatures: Visual commit log and diff viewer
Can act as a pager for Git output

alternatives.name: lazygit
mainFeatures: Simplified Git commands via single keypresses

alternatives.name: GitKraken
mainFeatures: Integrations with hosting services (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)

alternatives.name: SourceTree
mainFeatures: Visual commit history and branch diagrams
Staging and discarding by file, hunk, or line

marketPositioning: Gitu positions itself as a fast, keyboard-centric Terminal User Interface (TUI) Git client. Its primary market is developers who prefer working within the terminal environment and are looking for a powerful, interactive Git client that goes beyond the standard command-line interface. By taking inspiration from Magit, it aims to offer a comprehensive suite of Git functionalities within the TUI, appealing to users who value efficiency and a text-based workflow but do not use Emacs or prefer a standalone TUI application over a GUI. It competes with other TUI clients like lazygit and tig by offering a potentially more complete 'porcelain' experience closer to that of Magit, while differentiating itself from graphical clients like GitKraken and SourceTree by remaining entirely within the terminal.
